Controls.Description: BOT Service API must only be accessible over HTTPS
Controls.Rationale: Use of HTTPS ensures server/service authentication and protects data in transit from network layer eavesdropping attacks.
Controls.Recommendation: Make Web App linked to BOT Service to use Https using command 'Set-AzureRmResource -ResourceName '<WebAppName>' -ResourceGroupName '<RGName>' -ResourceType 'Microsoft.Web/sites' -Properties @{httpsOnly='true'} -Force '. Run 'Get-Help Set-AzureRmResource -full' for more help.

Controls.Description: Ensure to use own storage adapter instead of BOT Framework State Service API.
Controls.Recommendation: Refer https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/bot-service/dotnet/bot-builder-dotnet-state for implemeting state for BOT Service.

Controls.Description: Make sure secrets are not exposed.
Controls.Rationale: Keeping secrets such as passwords, keys, etc. in clear text can lead to easy compromise at various avenues during an application's lifecycle.
Controls.Recommendation: Refer https://azure.microsoft.com/en-in/documentation/articles/key-vault-get-started/ for configuring Key Vault and storing secrets.

Controls.Description: Make sure important activities and events during Bot interactions are logged.
Controls.Rationale: Analytics can be useful to detect unusual usage behavior patterns.
Controls.Recommendation: Follow https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/bot-service/bot-service-manage-analytics?view=azure-bot-service-3.0 for configuring Application Insight with BOT Service.
